reviews.text:
This Bridge needs to be re constructed immediately. It's a Vital bridge between Ontario Canada and Michigan USA. Hundred Thousand of Commuters and Commercial Trucks passing crossing every day. 
Very Old bridge have risk factor to be happen every moment. Please replace it with a new or re construct it immediately.

Really nice views from the bridge of both Wonder and Detroit. Tolls take a lot of time sometimes but if you have nexus then you don't need to worrry. Definitely fill up gas at duty free before crossing the border.
Very nice view. Traffic is pretty slow, so you can have a chance to look around and take in the sites. Make sure you got your ID...

The view of downtown Detroit and Windsor from the bridge is wonderful. However, the bridge itself is in bad condition of repair. It looks much better when seen from a distance, especially at night. Didn't really like the border crossing experience, will use the tunnel next time.

Not sure why it has such bad ratings, but we got through with no wait time.  I even went into the wrong lane and was able to back up to correct myself. We got some great pics and it was just a nice ride.

Church come on people a Church is a Church. Ever been in the military some time s--t happens and you learn to pray and find a church really fast, been there. so
 I visit different Churchs now and then. If you didn't get it join any 5 military services, you will learn quickly.
This is a terrific bus stop. I needed to get to Windsor and the tunnel bus took me there for $5.

Beautiful and fascinating historic church right in the heart of Detroit, at the foot of the Renaissance Center and facing Hart Plaza.  Easy parking in underground garage (entrance in median of Jefferson Ave.).  Sermons tend to be scholarly; politics mostly avoided.  Diverse congregation, friendly inclusive atmosphere.  World-class organ by D.F. Pilzecker of Toledo, OH.  Two highly skilled organists and excellent small professional choral ensemble.  Music is traditional Anglican, European and American liturgical standards, traditional hymnal; no pablum, all meat and potatoes.  Highly recommended.
Friendly and kind people! Beautiful music.
Got married there! Fr. Jeff and Charlotte are wonderful.
Convenient and clean.
I love what they have done with this little sliver of a park. A good place to rest and chat in between the now booming city!

Had a great time here. So many little shops adds a great flare to the area. The seating is nice and plentiful. Great place to read, write or just chill in the heart of downtown Detroit. If your in town go visit here and have some nice relaxing time in nature yet city vibes.

Better and better. Capitol Park is one of Detroit's downtown park jewels. In just a few short years it has gone from shabby to chic. There are a number of great restaurants and places to visit and more keep coming on line. If you are looking for a great time and don't know what you want, come to Capitol Park and pick a winner.

Me and my wife isn't at Capitol Park for the first time and we really enjoyed the pop-up Mexican restaurant. The overall feel is very quaint and we enjoyed ourselves. There are many good restaurants in Capitol Park if you want really good pizza is really good.
I was born, raised and love Detroit!

There is always some great activities all year around. During the summer they have a great variety of food trucks out and live music. Winter time they have amazing winter festivities from zip lining to ice skating. 👍🏽👍🏽👍🏽

Brought kids and in-laws to the area and it was a great place to enjoy the day in the city!  It was clean, well maintained and had plenty of shops, coffee, food in the area to walk to and enjoy.  A great place to start a day in the city!
It was so much fun. They should have music. The staff are extra nice. It is family fun for the whole family. Too warm up we enjoyed hot cocoa at local inn! It was really great!!

CM offers a nice atmosphere in the midst of Detroit's resurgent downtown. Not quite a park, but definitely a destination with lots of open space, easy access to downtown merchants and transport (Q line, People Mover).

Lots of events such as concerts, Winter Blast/ice rink, tree lighting, performance art, movies, etc. A public space in the true sense. 

Well lit, regularly patrolled, easy access and easy parking. Fair to say (IMO) that it's becoming the heart of downtown.
Wow what a place. Amazing in every respect. the staff for each respective business was super friendly and helpful, and the building was clean and the water display was amazing

The riverfront in Detroit is a beautiful place to go for a walk and enjoy the outdoors. Even in August the walkway wasn't that busy so my girlfriend and I were able to enjoy a peaceful walk right along the river.

There are a number of places that you can sit down and relax along the way. The scenery is beautiful and the views of Windsor are amazing!

Would love to return with a bicycle and further explore the Detroit Riverfront. Definitely recommend visiting if you're looking for something to do in Detroit during your trip.

Our family spent a wonderful hot day at the Riverwalk. The breeze was cool, the sun was shining, ice cream and slushies were refreshingly cold. The little one played in the fountain jets until cold and had a great time. A must for future family outings.

Paid over $300 for one night in a room about the size of a closet. Asked during check in if we could keep our vehicle parked there the next day while we went to the auto show. Was told no problem. Next day comes around and we were told we couldn't leave it there. Blankets on the beds felt more like rough curtains than soft blankets. Only really nice thing I can say about the stay was that the entire place was very clean, had a great view from the room, and there was a lot to do close by.

They did an awesome job on this project. It is a great place for a stroll or a bike ride or to sit and people watch by the water. The carousel, volleyball sand pit, fountains, murals and informational displays are great plus you can hop a boat to tour the river. Take an afternoon and check it out!
Gorgeous scenery along the Detroit river.  Great getaway for the kids

This sculpture is a great depiction of life. I love Detroit and the strength of the people here. This is a classic statue and landmark of Detroit, if you're visiting Detroit you have to come here for sure. You should also check out Bell Isle right up the road. It's a great part of Deteoit and super beautiful.
I love the Spirit of Detroit ❤️ statue; especially when he had on hometown team jersies
A true beauty when you come downtown.

It's still has not changed, the way people reacted with each other was absolutely fantastic and beautiful, parents interacted with their children their children interacted with their parents and everybody seemed to enjoy everybody else.
Great landmark attraction.

It's located down in the heart of the Motor City. The building is old & really quite fascinating. There security is very friendly & helpful. The only down fall is there is absolutely no parking. Your only option is Valet Parking at $14.00.
I remember the Penobscot building years ago when WJLB was high up top the Penobscot. Does anybody remember that phrase? Now it's use for Friend of the Court issues. So glad we're done with that.

Located in the heart of downtown Detroit, They have a restaurant and a mini store inside of the building. They have a public restroom. They have valet parking for 14.00  all day, the price has gone up since 2018 when valet parking was 12.00. They have helpful and friendly security. The building is clean. It is very hard to find free parking. There are many parking lots around the area, but you have to pay to park, the building does not have free parking and it is always crowded around the building.
This place is huge. Elevators are fast. The decor is classic
Friend of the Court should update their system and give the phone operators the correct information.

Excellent experience. From the moment the personnel at the door greet you to the front desk to the lobby bar to the club service - everything was excellent. The room was large and comfortable with modern furniture. The club lounge is smaller but provides many options and the staff there are excellent. All in all it was a pleasant stay.

Overall a great hotel right across the street from the federal courthouse. Wonderful room, and a good thing there are room darkening shades. The city lights light up the room at night of the shades aren’t closed. 

There was a snafu with extending the stay another night, but they were finally able to fix the issue. Will definitely stay here again.

Hotel was VERY accommodating! We got in at 9 am and they got us into our rooms immediately. They have two restaurants in the hotel, and although one is very expensive $$$$ the other is extremely reasonable. Hotel staff were very friendly. Staff at the Starbucks inside the hotel were simply outstanding. Would not only remember your user each day but your name as well. I was very impressed with this hotel. Conveniently located near so many interests... restaurants, the museum, convention center, and bus pick up area.

A very personable atmosphere. Warm, cozy. Very friendly staff. With that said, my feelings about the food. I went for brunch on a Sunday. The brunch buffet was well laid out. The offerings were wide-ranging. I tried everything except the bacon. The fried chicken was OUTSTANDING!!! well seasoned, crunchy. The home fries were crispy and tasty. The pancakes pare well with the chicken. The custom omelettes are tasty and substantial. Endless memosas are a must. I also had pasta salad, fruit and chocolate cake-all delicious.

Excellent and friendly staff! My room was very comfortable and quiet. I loved the dual waterfall shower!!!  Great location in the heart of downtown Detroit.  My company's employee  appreciation party was there. The food and service were fantastic!

We stayed here last weekend for my friends Emma and Emily's birthdays, and Alexis at the front desk was SO great! She was so nice, accommodating, and really tried to make the night special. We even got surprised by a complimentary birthday bottle of champagne and other snacks in the room! Overall a great experience and I would definitely recommend, especially while Alexis is working! :)

DoubleTree is a lovely place to stay I will let all my friends and family know how clean DoubleTree is and  everybody is so. Nice that's from the main lobby valet to the kitchen help special you miss Dottie that works in the kitchen hope to see you very soon 10. Stars 🌟

Stayed after a show at the Fox Theater. The location was within walking distance and reasonably priced. Rooms were comfy, clean and included nice personal touches. Staff was helpful in suggesting local restraunts. We will stay at a DoubleTree again based on this experience.

The room was clean....the view was even better!!!  We had an event so we didn't get to enjoy the view as much as you might.... but the continental breakfast seemed on point!!!   You can also order other dishes (which we did) omelettes, oatmeal, eggs Benedict, etc.....Tiffany was our server and did a fabulous job!!!  As I said we had an event.... but the cherry on top was this hotel!!!  Check it out!!!!

We booked the room online because it is a Baymont. The pictures online looked fine even though the ratings were not that great. The front desk staff are very pleasant and professional. 

The hotel setup and the rooms are very strange. All of the rooms have windows that look into the rooms like a motel. There seem to have been recent updates to improve the quality of the rooms and they didn't seem dirty. However, there was a strange chemical smell in the room and the hallways smelled like pot. 

We asked for our money back and the desk manager was very accommodating.

They serve a good lunch every day for people that need food. They also will let you have your mail delivered there if you have nowhere else to have it delivered. And helpers are all really nice to you. I give it two thumbs up.
These people ate great. Trish is awesome. Thank you.
We loved the history of this church. It was absolutely a beautiful building.
A house of God. A great place to worship. Love and peace abound
Nice people, beautiful setting,  Reformed tradtion worship style, youth programs, community outreach, outstanding music programs and concerts!

The Fox Theatre is almost legendary for how stunning it is, and it simply cannot be put into words how great this place is to visit. For adults, they offer some alcoholic beverages, but for the children they have popcorn and candy and stuff like that. The views are great from every seat, and the actors they put on are the best in the south. Les Miserables was amazing to witness, and with the great views, nice staff, and plenty of eating options, it's going to be hard to pass in the south. Absolutely recommend to anyone who wants a more formal night on the town with their family, friend, or lover.

The Fox is one of Atlanta's great dames. It's a beautiful palace. Architecturally stunning Moorish style design. Great place to see Broadway shows and attend events in the grand Egyptian ballroom.  But had a blast seeing my girl Mariah Carey! The BEST!

I love the Fox. It is a great music venue. It’s hard to believe that this historic Arabian motif building was almost torn down. The venue has approximately 4,600 seats all with unobstructed views. We just saw Trevor Noah, and we have see other musicals and concerts.
If you’re visiting Atlanta it’s one of the “must see” places here for the history and a great experience. It is a pricey for drinks and refreshments but that’s expected.One of my favorite places in Atlanta.

The beautiful Fox Theater is a landmark  in Atlanta. Wonderfully restored many years ago. I recently saw Les Miserables and sat in the orchestra section toward the back. No problem seeing the stage and all of the actors. The sound was clean and loud enough to be easily heard. If you have never been, please go. The wonderful blue star lit sky inside the theatre is amazing. The only negative is the traffic and parking. Very congested.  Took almost 1 hour to just get out of the parking garage.

This establishment is one of my all time favorite places to be. It definitely is my happy place. I have been to a total of 6 Broadway Productions and they were all so different in style and The Fox theater housed them so well. Very happy to have this Majestic theater in Atlanta.

Highly recommend. Might be a little bit of a wait but it is well worth it honestly the cheesecake is the best that I ever had. My favorite is the caramel apple one. They have really great cookies too. I always leave there happy.

I was really excited when we walked into this place, everything looked great! My mom and I decided on the chocolate mousse and some baklava. The baklava was good, not overwhelmingly sweet and dripping in honey. The chocolate mousse on the other hand was basically chocolate pudding with older whipped cream on top. It felt like it had been sitting for a few days. We were quite disappointed with the mousse and didn't eat it all.

The place is beautiful, really stunning bit the items tend to run a bit dry and parking 8s impossible.   No street parking so if you want to run in for 5 minutes to pick up a cake and run you will have to pay a daily parking rate (around $10) or drive in circles around the block until someone hopefully leaves (but you're not the only one looking)

Omygod accidentally found this bakery open until 1am. A must to try. I had the carrot bread pudding w pineapples simply delicious.This place has every dessert you could think of. Be sure to take a number lines out of this world

Love this place. Excellent deserts and the staff are fast and friendly. This was the only place that my husband could find ginger bread cookies during the Christmas season.  Love the downtown Detroit location.

It used to be a great restaurant.  Now it's ok.  Some dishes are still really  good such as the spinach pie and  broiled lamb chops.

But, and this is a big but, cleanliness is an issue.  I visited twice in a three week period. Both times, the women's bathrooms were so filthy they were unusable.  I  informed our waiters of this, and since I  was close to the restrooms, I  was able to observe that no one went in to clean during my remaining time there.

From then on we've been going to a restaurant across the street.

My boyfriend and I had many a memorable occasion at Pegasus.   So I  do miss the  place. Sigh.

The food is definitely delicious and the atmosphere is awesome.  The staff is friendly and it the experience you want from a traditional Greek restaurant.  We love it.  It can be very busy so go early.  But the bustle of a busy night is exciting.  Opa!
Been enjoying myself here for years!  Always have a nice draft beer selection, love their food and people.  I hadn't written a recommendation as I didn't want more people to know!

Amazing food! Great place to go for any occasion. Had the Combination platter and enjoyed every bite. Staff was very friendly and made our stay even better. The desserts are a must, we will be back very soon. Not a single downside to the dinner we enjoyed.

Great scenery,  close to the casinos and concert venues downtown. Food was always delectable and served fresh. Establishment is clean. Our waiter was courteous though she moved far to fast to ever hear an entire order so she often had to correct her. But she was a trooper about it and was extremely friendly.

I truly love this place!  This is good pizza at its best in the Midwest. I recommend this restaurant to all visitors upon touching down anywhere in Michigan.  The Greektown location is preferred due to the sparkling atmosphere one experience while taking in the cool breeze radiating from the waterfront.  PizzaPapalis provides a variety of tasty items to accommodate all Italian food lovers so yes, this is an invitation from a Detroit native to gather all friends and family for any occasion to great pizza with a twist of pure fun.

First off, our service was great.  Our waiter was friendly, prompt, and got our large order correct.  The food was OK.  Our bread sticks didn't taste fresh and the pizza was kind of average, but the pizza is more of a personal preference thing.  Others may love it.  There was a lot of sauce for my taste.

We had a big group and got seated somewhat quickly on a busy Sunday. I like that we were able to order our food before getting seated so it came fairly quickly after a table was available for us. We were are very happy with our pizza. Delicious! And so cheesy! Our server was quick and friendly. Thanks for the good experience.

This place was great. The wait staff were all very kind and helpful. The atmosphere was rustic looking with lots of wood. The pizza was incredible. They have thin crust as well as deep dish. It located in the cool Greek Town of downtown Detroit.

I got a half and half pizza last night, and i was honestly blown away at how delicious and filling it was! We both ate about 3 pieces each and we were full and satisfied. Definitely glad that we chose to try something new. The server was also very helpful in the choices that we had on the menu. We also tried the garlic bread with cheese and that was probably the best thing I had that night. The bread was so soft and delicious. thanks for a good experience.

Pretty good chili dogs-don't know if I would consider them the best (maybe in Detroit), but the atmosphere is pretty nice. Old, old restaurant-keeping with the original layout, and very packed. They have mostly bar stool seating (a few tables) and not very big in there; so when they are busy, you become friends your table neighbors very quickly. Nostalgic feel and a must try-especially since they've been around for over 100 years! I would've liked to have given them 4.5 stars but you can't on here. Oh, and have your calculator with you; the owner adds up your bill in his head...LOL
It was a nice experience. Dogs were great. Kids didn't eat though which was disappointing. A must dine in place for the original Coney Island hot dog.  Third generation Greek owned business!

This is very unique place. My 79 year old mother grew up going here with her dad. The hot dogs are high quality with skins that snap. The fries are cooked wonderfully. We ordered the traditional Coney's, fries and chili cheese fries. My mom's favorite are the loose burgers. The place was packed on a Saturday. They have a limited menu that they do well. I loved the old fashioned cash register. It felt like we went back in time.
I have been here countless times, hands down one of my favorite places to visit in the city. Best chili ever, the staff are so speedy and friendly. Love it here.

A Detroit institution and our first visit. 

We were confused at first because as you approach, there are two windows, each with people inside, making Coney dogs. If you're not paying attention, you'll miss the fact that so close together are two different Coney island hot dog restaurants, Lafayette and American.  (Spoiler alert, they originated as one, American Coney, but for some reason a long time ago, a brother of the original opened his own, right next door and called it Lafayette, after the street it's on)

Our meal was fast, cheap and delicious. The place was grimy, classic and perfect. There's a reason their so famous. Go check them out.

The staff is horrible. I don’t understand how there can be so many great reviews for this place!?!? They are so rude to their customers and treat us like children and yell at you if you have a large party. I have only been here twice but both times were completely horrible experiences. Go somewhere that will treat you with respect. The hostess was the worst person i have ever dealt with in my life and was more concerned about a reservation for their “regulars”. That’s fine and all but don’t treat your customers that are there at the moment spending money like complete trash. I also told her that i won’t be back and she was the worst hostess i have ever dealt with and she said she doesn’t care. Don’t waste your time or money.

This place was so much fun!! The atmosphere is VERY different and they had live music playing while I was there.  Antiques everywhere, even a tiny phone booth at the front of the bar.  The place is small, but I think a better word is "intimate". The drinks were STRONG so you absolutely get your money's worth. It's a fantastic place to go with a group (they have many booths to accommodate parties of 4+) and even a great place to go alone or on a date.
Cool spot downtown to grab a drink. The signature cocktails are strong and delicious.
Super fun. Great crowd. Great drinks. Really good live music. This is our new favorite.
Great place to grab a few drinks. Unique atmosphere for downtown.

CLOSED.  Sadly, after 16 years HR is permanently closed in Detroit.  Great place to bring the kids. They handle large parties well and have all the kids favorite foods. The music is also a real hit with the younger crowd so you just can't go wrong with the Hard Rock. Conveniently located across from Campus Martius right on Woodward Avenue.

We went during the last few days they were open. Popular place in the "D" to visit, unfortunately, rent prices forced it to close. Hopefully they find another location in Detroit and re open soon.
As typical with a Hard Rock, the walls are adorned with music history. Hard Rock Detroit walls are adorned with Motown History, highlighting Michigan movers and shakers.
If visiting, please check to see if they found a new location.
The food was great. The service was also great. I am going to miss you all. I hope you find a new location soon.

Best hamburger ever. The wings & cauliflower wings was awesome too. Our server was awesome knowledgeable and pre bussed our table . It's a shame they are closing. If they relocate the need to find a place easier to get in to not have to walk 3 blocks away or more to get there. I walk with cane it was a challenge to get there. Thankful I did. Well worth it.💕

It's really gone downhill.  Pretty disappointing since it's such a prime location.  It used to be a great place to go, with great service, smiling faces, and food and drinks that although chain food, was always decent.  Whoever was running that place in 2009-2013 time frame really had a good grasp on things.  Now... I dread going there.  The hosts are slow and stupid or pretend to be. The food is lackluster, the drinks are still decent, but the place was empty... We waited 30 minutes to be seated, when there was a full staff doing nothing, and only about 5 tables sat, max 4 per table.  I used to visit often, and now only when invited in a group.. that has been 1 time in 2018..and trust me, it won't be again.  *EDIT DATE 10/31/18. Mike the GM took a step in the right direction by replying to this review.  I've emailed, we'll chat, and I'll follow back up here with any feedback.

Luke was a fantastic bartender! Attentive craftsmanship sets Wright & Co apart from other cocktail bars - and the small plates were absolutely divine. They have a rotating menu, but if you catch them with their loaded potato chips on, you have to give them a try! You will not be disappointed by a single bite or sip you'll take here, and the wait will be worth every second.

Awesome atmosphere... Got there 6:30ish, was pretty empty and got a nice spot and within an hour restaurant/bar was full. The food was really good. Small plates concept, reasonably prided for quality/quantity. The lamb shank, veal, avocado salad and cauliflower pictured below were all excellent!

This was a wonderful experience. We had to wait an hour and a half for seating but the meal, drinks and service we received made it well worth the wait. The cocktails are unique and well done and each item we ordered for dinner was perfection. The speakeasy type entrance and the interior design to match really complemented the experience

The place is great for small bites/sharing. The staff was great. We tried multiple things on the menu and they were all good.  I didn't care for the chips as much as the other items but my companion loved them. Skip the cocktail list and go for something off the list unless you want to pay twice as much. Look up when you visit! They have a fabulous fan system that runs off pulleys! I definitely recommend.
Fantastic food. It has a great New York City vibe to it. Great view of Downtown Detroit. I recommend it!

Most spectacular view in town and the highest point in Detroit metro. We made reservation right before sunset but didn't get a table facing sunset, so I guess they don't deserve tables specifically. 

Ordered the prime rib. Basically one of the best steak I have eaten ever. It is enough for Two believe me. 16 oz. got the baked potato with it, which was normal, and the tomato salad which was very good. 

All the deserts are amazing!!! You won't be disappointed with any of them. 

They validate parking tickets for discount.
This is a high upscale restaurant. Make sure you dress nicely. The food was great but I don't think I would go back there. You get a nice view of the skyline if it's a clear day

Elegant, delicious and incredibly compensating.

Took my girlfriend here for her 22nd Birthday and we were not only welcomed but well fed and entirely taken care of.

I personally requested a Harry Potter themed Birthday greeting for her, but they one upped me and literally wrote her a Harry Potter Birthday message on her dessert, custom.

100% the ultimate Birthday experience I sought to offer. We will definitely be back.

And I'd like to provide a personal shout out and appraisal to our server. An epic gentleman that helped my girlfriend decide on wine, made sure the Harry Potter message was served AND genuinely made us feel welcomed and cared for. Coach Insignia is lucky to have Danny as a server. I can't speak highly enough of his hospitality, charm and consideration. 

Returning soon,

Alexander J Singer

Had dinner here for my girlfriend's birthday. The staff all wished her happy birthday and when we ordered a dessert to share it came with a candle and "Happy Birthday" written in chocolate. The service and the food were excellent. Plus, it has the best view in Detroit. It was our first time dining here but we will definitely be returning.

The view is amazing and so is the service. We went at happy hour and we're thrilled by the friendly and attentive waiters as well as the sweeping views of the city and river. The food and cocktails are not very good. We ordered a charcuterie plate which was quantity over quality and the drinks were sugar heavy. That being said, I've never has as good a view of a big city for such a low price.

The Rattlesnake is one of the most outstanding restaurants you'll find anywhere. It's great that we have it right here in Detroit. It's riverfront setting, beautiful decor, friendly staff and great food are what makes the place so appealing. They've been doing it for many years. It's an exceptionally comfortable place. Great for a date with your newest partner or a long time flame. Go! You'll love it.

Visited last night party about 24.  Two of us couldn't eat what they had to offer on the party menu.  The waiter was very professional in handling the situation.  The chef was very accommodating....food and service was top notch, maki g for a very nice evening..Thank you.

Club was nice, service was great. We were there for a wedding which was beautiful! The appetizers we're wonderful! How ever the salmon I ordered for dinner was under cooked, the pot roast my husband had was great. We had a great time!

I went for restaurant week I was kind of upset it took 40 minutes to be seated after my reservation time. I ordered the duck it was very good the drinks not so good for the price valet a very good price $5 for valet at a nice restaurant was cheap I recommend  dining for restaurant week only if I had to pay regular prices they would only get 2 stars.

Delicious food, great presentation, attentive waitstaff and nice ambience. We went for Detroit restaurant week, it's an biannual event ( or just yearly) and only my second time eating here. Very satisfied once again.

I love this place. SavannahBlue is a soul food fine dining restaurant. The Mac & Cheese is a must get but don't sleep on the shrimp and grits. Exceptional customer service. We loved Ricardo. Great date night place or good for parties dinner. The food and drinks are really amazing.

One of the best restaurants I’ve been to! We had the hummus appetizer, the fried chicken, crab cakes and the oxtail. Absolutely everything was delicious, and we’ll be sure to eat here again when visiting Detroit. Great modern twists on Southern comfort food. Stopped in on the recommendation of a chef at the Motor City Casino, he did not steer us wrong! Great food, and delicious drinks. I can't wait to go back.
Food is amazing. Everything on the menu looked delicious. We had a hard time choosing. Staff is friendly and attentive. Location is great. Dinner and drinks for four was reasonable.

You always hear that people are quick to leave bad reviews so anytime I have a horrible experience somewhere, I make sure that I leave a review for one of my good experiences as well. My husband had reservations and we went to Savannah Blue on Valentine’s Day. All of the staff was very nice. They have a nice waiting lounge but we were seated right away! The food was great. It was southern style but the atmosphere was upscale. The drinks were not watered down, strong. The music level was even perfect. Although the tables were closer together, the music was loud enough not to here the table next to you, but not too loud where you couldn’t hear the conversation at your own table. The price to portion size was also good. Not overly expensive, but expected for a nice restaurant and the portions were good. The wait for the food wasn’t too long either. Overall experience was immaculate. I LOVED The mac n cheese and crab cakes. Chicken was fried perfectly too!

My wife and I visited Detroit for the weekend in January 2019 and several friends recommended this restaurant. Great food. Large portions. Great atmosphere. I would highly recommend SavannahBlue to friends. If possible, make a reservation in advance.

We stayed here last weekend for my friends Emma and Emily's birthdays, and Alexis at the front desk was SO great! She was so nice, accommodating, and really tried to make the night special. We even got surprised by a complimentary birthday bottle of champagne and other snacks in the room! Overall a great experience and I would definitely recommend, especially while Alexis is working! :)

DoubleTree is a lovely place to stay I will let all my friends and family know how clean DoubleTree is and  everybody is so. Nice that's from the main lobby valet to the kitchen help special you miss Dottie that works in the kitchen hope to see you very soon 10. Stars 🌟

Stayed after a show at the Fox Theater. The location was within walking distance and reasonably priced. Rooms were comfy, clean and included nice personal touches. Staff was helpful in suggesting local restraunts. We will stay at a DoubleTree again based on this experience.

The room was clean....the view was even better!!!  We had an event so we didn't get to enjoy the view as much as you might.... but the continental breakfast seemed on point!!!   You can also order other dishes (which we did) omelettes, oatmeal, eggs Benedict, etc.....Tiffany was our server and did a fabulous job!!!  As I said we had an event.... but the cherry on top was this hotel!!!  Check it out!!!!

We booked the room online because it is a Baymont. The pictures online looked fine even though the ratings were not that great. The front desk staff are very pleasant and professional. 

The hotel setup and the rooms are very strange. All of the rooms have windows that look into the rooms like a motel. There seem to have been recent updates to improve the quality of the rooms and they didn't seem dirty. However, there was a strange chemical smell in the room and the hallways smelled like pot. 

We asked for our money back and the desk manager was very accommodating.

Excellent experience. From the moment the personnel at the door greet you to the front desk to the lobby bar to the club service - everything was excellent. The room was large and comfortable with modern furniture. The club lounge is smaller but provides many options and the staff there are excellent. All in all it was a pleasant stay.

Overall a great hotel right across the street from the federal courthouse. Wonderful room, and a good thing there are room darkening shades. The city lights light up the room at night of the shades aren’t closed. 

There was a snafu with extending the stay another night, but they were finally able to fix the issue. Will definitely stay here again.

Hotel was VERY accommodating! We got in at 9 am and they got us into our rooms immediately. They have two restaurants in the hotel, and although one is very expensive $$$$ the other is extremely reasonable. Hotel staff were very friendly. Staff at the Starbucks inside the hotel were simply outstanding. Would not only remember your user each day but your name as well. I was very impressed with this hotel. Conveniently located near so many interests... restaurants, the museum, convention center, and bus pick up area.

A very personable atmosphere. Warm, cozy. Very friendly staff. With that said, my feelings about the food. I went for brunch on a Sunday. The brunch buffet was well laid out. The offerings were wide-ranging. I tried everything except the bacon. The fried chicken was OUTSTANDING!!! well seasoned, crunchy. The home fries were crispy and tasty. The pancakes pare well with the chicken. The custom omelettes are tasty and substantial. Endless memosas are a must. I also had pasta salad, fruit and chocolate cake-all delicious.

Excellent and friendly staff! My room was very comfortable and quiet. I loved the dual waterfall shower!!!  Great location in the heart of downtown Detroit.  My company's employee  appreciation party was there. The food and service were fantastic!

I loved our visit to the Heidelberg Project. We took a young friend who is from Berlin and had heard about it on a cold winter day. It was impactful and I found it moving. It is above and beyond the typical & made our friend very thoughtful about this alternate view of America, as well. When you’re there step I to the indoor space and purchase something or leave a donation. The people who are staffing the project are happy to talk to you and exchange ideas. This is a unique artistic expression and deserves to be supported.

After all these years, Tyree is still steady at work as curator and caretaker of this experience. It was great to see him on site wishing happy holidays to all the attendees on a weekend afternoon. Fun for a jaunt, enough substance for a deep dive if you have the time and interest.
There are not too many things to see, even though you can take cool pictures
Strangest thing.... almost right out of a horror movie! highly recommended... in the daylight

This is a must see. It reminds you of the reason why one should love their neighbors and not take time for granted.
As Captain Hook says.." I Hate Clocks".
I only hope for the future for all artist and tenants I love this place wonderful for the community perfect artsit hub
I guess it's a good place for events, but the parking absolutely sucks! Either get there early or don't wear heels.
definitely for adults with higher of intelligence. children would not be recommended to bring. Kids... you gotta stay home.
GREAT ARTIST. AWESOME FEEL OF LIKE YOU WANDERING THROUGH A REALLY FANCY SCHMANCY BUILDING. OLD ELEVATORS/STAIRS AND MARK ARMINSKI.... WHAT ELSE CAN YOU ASK FOR!
We went to an off beat art show here and had a good time.

The Anna Scripps Observatory is none of my favorite places to visit and bring guests. The sights, smells and atmosphere keeps me coming back. I enjoy plants, herbs and nature so I especially like coming during the summer. It's a must to visit here when you come to Belle Isle and they have done so much on the island that you will want to come out to see the improvements anyway.
Amazing architecture, very warm friendly place.  Very family oriented. It's like stepping through time when visiting this place.  It's neat to see how far aquariums have come.

Beautiful all year long. The detail and planning can be seen and respected throughout the greenhouse in every room. The best part is while the overall place remains the same plants are constantly changing so a trip every few months is worth it.

This place was absolutely amazing! So much historical significance and live exhibits. Our tour guide was so knowledgeable and personable. She really made an enjoyable trip into an outstandingly memorable one. Thank you!
Looks like a very Natural setting to get away to the Every Day Stresses..Just imagine having Butterflies land on ones head arm shoulder...Part of Nature is all around You

My first time back since I was a kid.  It may be small but they sure house a lot to see! The tanks and fish are very well taken care of.  There's lots of exotic fish from all over the world.  And it's free however I do hope people leave donations to help the animals and their upkeep.  What a fun time!

You get to see and learn a lot about the aquatic life in Michigan as well as some of the more interesting aquatic life around the world. It was clean for the amount of foot traffic that goes through there. It is small and consists of one room. Also, there is no ac. But you get what you pay for, which is zero dollars. So for the price, it is a great value

The aquarium is housed in a beautiful historic building with tons of character from the green tile ceiling to the stonework exterior. In terms of presentation it is small compared to other modern aquariums but this is more than made up for with excellent exhibits and passionate employees. There is no admission to enter although donations are appreciated upon exiting. My family really enjoyed our visit and I'm sure yours will as well.
We love this place. Make sure you grab the laminated sheets and do the scavenger hunt. Such a great place for the local community. The people are so nice, helpful and knowledgeable.
Old and ornate. Free! Very nice tanks with a large variety of aquatic creatures from all over but particularly the Great Lakes. Please throw a few bucks into the donation box!

The atmosphere was nice and the staff was friendly. The food left a lot to be desired. I would still say to check it out at least once.    (Response: Who should I ask for at the corporate office? Thank you for the prompt response.)

Great decor, great vibe, great pizza, great service. Came in there 30 minutes before closing on a Monday evening, and it was only maybe about three people in there. Ordered eight slices and it came in about 10 minutes.   So I had a good time. I'm sure it's possibly a little different on a busy Saturday evening but my trip there was a good one. Will definitely be going there again.

If you enjoy a pizza with a thicker crust, it's really good! I'm used to pizza on the East Coast but was pleasantly surprised with how tasty it was. We also got the meatballs and wings which were excellent and the mozzarella sticks could have been a little more crispy and golden. We loved the Detroiter pizza too. But otherwise, it was a great meal after spending 9 hours in the car to get to Michigan!
Good food and service. And no wait!! (We went early) The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is the cheese sticks could have been a little warmer. Pizza was very good.
I went here on a date... What a fun place!  I really enjoyed the cheese ravioli, and he had chicken parmesan.  Nice place, good service.  :-)

I've been here three times. Looks clean and pretty good service, no problems finding a parking spot. The food is good and I would give more stars if they would get my order right. I ordered three orders of veggie rice without egg. Every time at least one of the orders has had egg and even once got egg and chicken. After the second time my SO complained that his rice was crunchy.

Did this place get new owners?  Cash only with an atm in the entryway. (3$ for those who don't carry cash).  We ordered lunch here and the vegetable curry was kind of cold. The rest if the food was cool too. A little heavy on the red pepper so watch the spice level. The food just wasn't the same. Haven't been here in about a year but, it wasn't the same.  Service was ok. Lunch for 2 with soup and an app was 36.00.
Best place to get Thai food..... If you love spicy food come here.... They also have other selection of you don't like spicy food
Food very ordinary.  I love Thai food but this one is near the bottom.  I went with a friend.  Both of our meals were slightly hotter than room temperature.  Pretty boring.  Not recommended.
must be under new ownership. seems the quality of food has changed as well as they are now cash only? not a fan

Always a great time at this place. It's nothing fancy, I'd call it a great dive bar, but it's a Detroit classic. Feather bowling and great music are my two favorite things about this place (although I have yet to try the feather bowling). They have music of all types so there's bound to be something you like. Don't fear the area, the parking is in a well lit, fenced lot.I have never been afraid when we go here. Good times for sure!

A unique and fun experience. Go for the feather bowling but be sure to make a reservation as they only have two lanes. Bar food available. Mussels are their specialty, but not something I've wanted to try! A very old place with no-frills character.
Great food at fair prices. Best customer service. I really enjoy my time here!
Had a couple doctors mention how much they liked this place. Now I know why. European cuisine and old bar atmosphere creates a welcome space for old friends and ex-pats to gather family style.

The drinks here, are the "Real Thing."
The food is pretty good too.
I really hated to see the original owners family leave.
But, hey,,, the NEW owners are O.K.
They did keep the drinks the same way as before.
Thank you, Cadieux Cafe.

Commander, Bell / U.S. Navy

We came for dinner and it was excellent. 
We made reservations and we were not disappointed. It was so incredibly good and we are so full! You will not be dissatisfied in the meal or service! Be sure to make a reservation because this place gets easily crowded especially on weekends!
Best waiters ever! Full of historical facts about movie stars that have dined there. Food was phenomenal.  Bella 🤩
Food was great.   Bar tender was conversational and polite
The food is good and tasty! Had the red sauce pasta with shrimp and my sister got the chicken fettuccine, they use such big plate that makes the portion so little. Dessert was good too.
Best steak in town really enjoyed atmosphere service was great should make reservations

If you’re not interested in the library aspect, still be sure to take a visit. The details & architecture of this building are so cool. They also always have little exhibits & fun things going on. It’s a must stop if you’re at the DIA.

The entranceof the Detroit public library is grand with marble arches and long wide halls. The third floor however has alwaysbeen my favorite.  Walk up the center stair case and to see tall arched windows  decorated with stain glass. You feel as though you're inside an ivory tower with high frescoes decorated with copper squares.  The paintings in the arches or the walls seem to be renaissance inspired two story art pieces that tell a tale of a different time. If there wasn't any books this place would make an amazing museum but it has books, films and music which makes it better.  Try to visit every gallery upstairs that you can and feel the grandeur of the place. They top this off with friendly staff.

It's a damn shame that Deb Dorsey and Lauren's Dorsey would do their nephew Cunningham horribly, and abandon them because they are lgbtq. They put on such a pleasant and kind front but they do their family wickedly. Deb Dorsey threw away the Wonder Bible that their nephew Cunningham had given them with his panhandling money. Cunningham Junior was always polite even at the Christmas party.
architecturally stunning. an homage to books  + culture that modernization has barely touched. directly across the street from two museums on the M1 Woodward Avenue
As a Detroit native and now a public librarian in Topeka Kansas, this library is the stuff dreams are made of. Heading home in January and plan to have a nice long visit. Can’t wait ❤️

This place is awesome. It features some really cool exhibits on Detroit's history, everything from a real-life recreation of a street long ago, to a functioning automobile body drop from the old Clark Street Cadillac plant. There is also an interactive model train display in the basement. On some weekends, they also screen documentary films about the city's history. And best of all, admission is free! All the standard exhibits, changing exhibits, and documentaries can be accessed and viewed free of charge. This is truly Detroit's most underrated attraction, a must-see for anyone visiting the area.

This museum does an excellent job telling the story of our city.  When I was a kid, I especially enjoyed the basement, the old streets of Detroit.  Decades later, the kid in me still needs to visit them every year, along with the fun exhibits (both permanent and temporary) on the floors above.  It'll never be Detroit's most visited attraction, but if you're reading reviews you're already interested enough that you have to go.

Detroit Historical Society is a wonderful place to go to soak up Detroit's story by being surrounded by artifacts that show off it's importance to the area and to the country.  The exhibits are awesome and interesting.  Plus it's a great place to hold events.

Such an awesome adventure. I've been there before, although it's been a while. This time was nice because I was with women from my church that are part of our Women's Ministry. We really enjoyed the Motown exhibit including a special section celebrating legendary songstress Aretha Franklin.
Awesome to learn about the history of this great city. Excellent and knowledgeable staff that were able to answer all our questions. Make sure to check out the gift shop!

Awesome place to take the kids for an overnight indoor campout in the winter. The staff is very kid friendly and understands how to deal with them (they give them some slack, lots of instruction, and make sure the parents and kids know what is expected.

Quite a few displays need some TLC. Examples; the water rocket on the right barely fills with water, several exhibits have no wording or explanation of what they do, and the pedal drive flywheel chain skips badly.

It's definitely worth your time, but it could be a five star learning place for kids if they put in just a little extra effort.
Great variety of exhibits that engage children of different ages. Wonderful stage shows. Very good value. So much to see, and my four year old loved it so much, we became members.

My kids are 9 and 7. They always look forward to going here.
100% recommend buying the yearly family pass. It works at so many locations other than the Michigan Science Center.
The facility is always very clean. The presentations are very well done. Can't recommend it enough.
If you're visiting here, keep in mind there are other museums surrounding the Science Center. You may want to take the time to check them out as well.

Why did I feel underwhelmed, like the Science Center used to be way better than it is now? They were having some sort of computer problem when we arrived on a Saturday morning so they were going to let us in for free, but we said we wanted admission to the planetarium the computers seemed to be working fine and then it was $60 for three of us. Not sure what that was about.

Hands on interaction science and technology  that's half playground half science fair. Annual membership is the best value as it allows return trips and partners with other science centers where the membership is also good. There were a lot of non functional exhibits here though that seemed broken so I could not give a 5 star rating.

Glorious. A beautiful and historic church in Midtown Detroit. It's historic for its age, over 120 years old, and for its role in the Underground Railroad. In fact there they host the Underground Railroad Living Museum. I was there during the annual Noel Night listening to a concert of madrigal singers perform.
I attended a baby shower here & I vote here. Clean, well maintained historic venue & church located in midtown headed/close to downtown Detroit.
They give away clothes at least once in a while. You can fill up as many bags as u like. The staff is nice and friendly.
The place was HUGE... there is an underground railroad .... I am truly impressed
Temporarily used by Hannan House during renovation.
A very good school.... My daughter loves attending classes here...
Great space for events or parties.
Great place for creative students. Shinola watch factory is located inside

What a beautiful historical landmark in the heart of New Center, accessible, and with a long history. We had a friend show us around the building. There is a guided tour and a theatre show was going on, however, we didn’t attend either. I like that Pure Detroit and the Peacock Room were in the Building for some cute shopping. Gorgeous architecture.

Such a magnificent building. They added a bunch of local shops inside as well as another amazing coffee shop. You can spend an afternoon here. 
I definitely recommend taking a tour that is offered because you learn how much love the Fisher brothers put into the city and their namesake building!

A must see building when visiting Seattle. The place itself reminds how glorious and rich Detroit once was. With amazing architecture, fine details and lots of gold finishes it shows true craftsmanship. No single bas-relief or ceiling painting is the same. Definitely worth visiting, especially that lobby entrance is free and open for 24 hours.
Beautiful building! Amazing theater. Bathrooms are hard to find and in the basement. Had no lock on my stall. But overall, gorgeous building. Saw the Broadway show 'Hamilton'. Great experience.

I always enjoy the Fisher Building and the theater when I attend. It is a beautiful building with a few boutiques. I advise everyone to go whenever they have a chance.  They theater also has a bar for refreshments as well as good entertainment.

Always the best vegan food! I love that all their options are at least vegetarian, they make going out to eat very easy for vegans, usual it's hard to find a nice restaurant that has options to choose from, not here! Have been there multiple times and haven't had two of the same dishes! They also have meals that are already paired with delicious wines! I highly recommend this spot even if you aren't vegetarian or vegan, they just have delicious food no matter how or what you eat!

Very delicious, although not my favorite place in the area. They were pretty dead and we were there around prime dinner time so we got sat and taken care of immediately. The dessert was quite literally the icing on top. I would go back for just this amazing coconut cake.
Great food.  Large yet intimate space.  Great drink options.  We went during happy hour and enjoyed a meal.  The Gouda Tots are a real treat.

When I walked in, the vibe wasn't super welcoming. There wasn't anyone there to great me and the want a place to be "received", but I was expected to wait to be seated. That made it kind of awkward. Rhett server was friendly enough, but I felt like I was interrupting her from doing something else when she seated me. There were other people there, but it wasn't crowded. It was a Friday afternoon. Once I was deserted and my date served, things went much better. The server spoke highly of our choices when asked what she thought. And, she was correct. Both dished were VERY good. I had the pesto dish and it was perfect! My date had an Asian spicy stirfry l fry with peanuts. It was very tasty as well. I really wish there was a Seva in Toledo Ohio.

I am a meat eater but I went with my friends that don't. I found the place to be very nice. I ordered the baked Mac n cheese. It was very good, I would eat it any day of the week. My buddy got the veggie burger, he cut a small chunk off of it for me and I was very surprised at how much it looked and tasted like real beef. I have tried a couple veggie burgers in the past and this one was by far the best I tasted before. Yam fries were good too. 

While I have no plans to stop eating meat, I would not hesitate on eating here again.
This has always been a spot where you can get good food and drinks in a relaxing, laid back atmosphere. Their calamari is some of the best I've ever had.
Very good food, good vibes, excellent service! Shout out to Darby, told me it was one of his last days there and he was still working hard! Definitely a good place to check out!

Pleasant staff, great atmosphere, and beautiful art displayed. The food is delicious. I have been coming here for years and will continue to. Love the layout and interactive intimacy. One of my favorite bars with signature cocktails and local liquor options. Two thumbs up

One of my favorite places to eat in downtown Detroit. They have lots of vegetarian and even some vegan options (as well as food for carnivores). Also has a decent size bar and the service is always solid. Only pain can be parking, they do have a few spots behind their building, but if that lot is full, hit the parking garage behind that, it's only a minute walk. 👍😁
Never had a bad meal and the service is great. Love the local art. Made use of the bar and the upstairs level with large groups also. Had great experiences.

This recent trip is our family’s second stay at Shangrila Bangkok. The first was awesome, which brought us back for our second. This stay has been comfortable and enjoying for my children, as well as my parents. Friendly and helpful staff at the lobby on our arrival. My 6 year old girl vomited after our taxi ride from the airport. A few female young staff were extremely helpful, quickly handing us towels and helped consoling my girl, and later offered her a drink. These staff were so fast and so helpful! We felt very warm at heart!!! Our balcony rooms were wonderful. And I must highly recommend the breakfast at next2. Superb variety, great food and very attentive service! We will definitely come back!

Thank you for the colleague who did the check in. Even our room booking was under staff rate, she was patient to introduce and solve our problem which was treating us as guest. Very helpful and kind.
Also, the Chi spa was excellent. I went to Thailand and tried different spa for many times. The therapist-Honey in Chi spa was even the best. Her warm smile made me felt welcomed at the beginning and the massage made me felt worth to pay. Thank you for the relaxing experience she gave to me.

This place has been around for a while now, and it's well-known among the locals - for good reason! It's a superb hotel, and the staff members are excellent. Our company reserved the conference hall for a half day and evening for a full company meeting, and everything went really well. The Chinese dinner they served was excellent! (Peking duck - very, very good.)

Really, there are no complaints about this place. It's an added bonus that the hotel is sitting right next to the Chaophraya River, and you can get great views from the hotel bar or even the pool deck.

Would be a great getaway place.

I would have loved to give it a 5 star because of its location and ambience but reducing a star for complexity of navigating between meeting rooms and Building wings. You can't help being lost. Having said that, staff are very helpful and show you the way and you reach your destination walking really long!

The staff were kind, and the food in the lounge was delicious.
Only thing to be improved is cleanliness of the table in the lounge. I could see the traces of the cups left in many places and a little bit sticky when I am touching on surface of the table. It seems they have not wiped the table clean after the customer left.

And the communication skill/ background information about hotel facility should be more improved. We asked if we could borrow ping-pong racket /ball to play table tennis near swimming pool (Depending on each hotel policy, we used to borrow the racket and ball before) however, the staff in Krungthep lobby told us that we have to purchase the racket and ball in Robinson shopping mall whereas we found that racket and ball were equipped beside on the table while taking a walk later.

We have visited Atlas Global Bistro three times over the past year, and enjoyed each visit. The menu is varied and innovative; the food always well-prepared and delicious. The wine list is remarkably varied with a wide range of excellent American, French, and Italian choices. Interesting old-time cocktails followed the authentic recipes. Yes, it is rather pricey. I don't mind paying a little bit more for a special occasion to have a restaurant choice in midtown with reliably good food, service, and wine selection.

The menu is "different" but in a good way. Relatively few dishes but covering all regions of the world. Everything we had on the table was definitely "different" from the typical chain food but very good in taste. A little more expensive than your regular chain restaurant but the location is great for before/after show visits in the Fox, the DSO, the Opera or the Fisher Theater. 
We will be back.

I do enjoy the Atlas, for Norman who are you to call ordinary when all your reviews are born since you signed up in June 2012. Are you the owner of McClure pickles, if you are I have to compliment you on the garlic pickles. I am glad you enjoyed Cafe Cortina. Good choice on your part. Ordinary is not a good word Norman.
After being sat at the bar....our food arrived late, and was incorrect. The wait staff was also caught picking at the food in a last second effort to correct the order. Poorly managed.
Food has terrific thought and time put into it. just awesome, a pbit expensive but quality is the best. Totally worth it.

Had the opportunity to help clean the station in 2009 with some of my fellow community station enthusiasts. Here are a few of the pictures from that day. Some art remained on the walls from a snazzy party that was held years earlier. I am honestly super excited that Ford will repair and open this beautiful jewel to the public. Thank you Ford!

What a beautiful building! Despite it falling into disrepair! I'm super excited to see what Ford has planned! My biggest dream? Is to reconnect the existing tracks at the Grand Central station's still working main line, with the old switch at Greenfield Village! F.Y.I. Yes, there is 2 switches, one from the current working main line into Greenfield Village & one from the Village to the inside of the Henry Ford museum. That's how they got the train exhibit in the building in the first place!! It would be great to be able to tour to & from  the Grand Central station & Greenfield Village & the Henry Ford museum!!!

The Michigan Central Station is a historic landmark.  It was in continuous use for many decades until Detroit went through what could be called a dispersion period when the central city changed.  Manufacturing and residents departed for several different reasons.  Rail travel also declined.  The station was not needed as much of the freight transfer work could be done without needing such a large structure.  At the same time manufacturing began departing the United States and notably from Michigan.  The surge of building and expansion that had been expected in Detroit never occurred.

The building was left vacant for some time and recently was purchased by the Ford Motor Company.  The Ford Motor Company is repairing and remodeling the structure.  There doesn’t seem to be any plans for resuming any sort of rail service at this location but we can hope, can’t we?

The building already has new windows in it and is looking more like the powerful center point of commerce that it should be rather than the derelict building it was tending to.

It's a very nice building, despite how it looks.
But my family was excited to see the landmark
Wonderful building. Sad that people let it fall into ruins. Best of luck to restoring it!
In the last couple of years the place has really went down

Matthew is wonderful great customer service made us feel comfortable stay in contacts with us making sure we had a cleared understanding of what we was paying for .I loved there professionalism toward my family.I am very pleased with the service I received from the cemetery and on top of everything.Their grounds are well kept up which was a plus for me. Thanks again for allowing my Dad service to go well. Only thing I didn't like was his head stone beach was missing the creamation canisters so hopefully that will get fixed but I think that wasn't there mistake but the company mistake.
Very clean and very well kept up.
Go to the cemetery all the time my kids love feeding the duck's
All my loved ones are laid to rest here. It's peaceful.

Our number one choice for Mexican food is Taqueria Mi Puebla! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu (steak and shrimp street tacos pictured) because it is all so good! The service is great even when they are packed and you can't go wrong with the atmosphere! You wont be disappointed if you decide to try them for yourself!

I have been here at least 20 times would give Taqueria Mi Pueblo five stars easily. But they almost always fall short with the hostess and waitresses. Especially the head hostess. The lady who takes you to a table has a bad attitude. AlWAYS .One of the experiences of going to a good ,well ran restaurant is to have good service .Smiles ,a good attitude, small talk.Best food in the world and snotty bad attitudes just don't mix. 3 and a half Stars. Would come more often if they would only have a better attitude. Never hello ,never how are you, not even a thank you while paying or leaving. I really like the food.so I don't say anything. I don't want to get 86 from the place you know what I mean.
Omg food was great. It's real authentic Mexican food and is great... Great drinks as well. The mango margarita is a must. Great customer service too!!! This is my new restaurant

The margaritas are huge, tasty, and cheap!! The delicous Paloma had me a little tipsy restaurant despite it's somewhat small size and was cheap so I still give it 5 stars. Fajitas were grilled to perfection. Great prices for everything!! Loved the regular salsa but the hot salsa has an intense cilantro flavor so if you're not a fan of cilantro I'd skip the hot salsa. This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant

I have been eating at this restaurant since the owner grilled the food on the sidewalk. I've watched this place grow into what it is over the years and have supported the owner financially as a loyal customer. However, I will never eat here again due to the simple fact that there is "resist" art in the vestibule area of the restaurant. As a proud American and supporter of our president, I do not feel welcome eating at a restaurant that supports the "resist" movement.
Great food and service.  Warm atmosphere and very personable employees. Love to stop by for quick drink and then just happen to settle in and have a few more.
This is the best Mexican restaurant in RI.  Don't be confused by the lower budget interior.  The food is fantastic.
Amazing food, beautiful people cooking and serving. They made us feel at home
The small environment and the staff make this place feel very homely and comfortable. Food was delicious, great portion size, and was prepared & served very quickly. Will definitely go back!

This place is a hidden gem on Dexter Ave. super authentic and humble- if you want Mexican and are in the Lincoln/Pawtucket area find this place. I’ve been a frequent flyer here for a long time- highly recommended.
The food was excellent! The wait staff was helpful and very courteous. For someone who is more of a comfortable restaurant goer, this upscale restaurant was enjoyable.
Fantastic food, service and setting. The area is still a bit shady but they do what they can to keep their customers safe (guard in the parking lot). It's a good idea to have reservations here.
This was an excellent restaurant and worth the trip downtown just to visit it. The service is excellent and the food is top notch.
Amazing food, good atmosphere.  One of the best lasagna I've had
I can't wait to go back.  The food was delicious and the staff was helpful and excellent overall.

This is the ultimate family restaurant! My family comes here almost every other week and we love it. They have great Italian food and great service. I would like to see a little change happen to the menu as I have now tried just about everything on it and am ready for something new. I would also like to see some specials get offered in order to change things up. The baked mostaccioli is the best and the chicken noodle soup is also great! If you are looking for a true family Italian experience this is the place for you. Also, don't be alarmed by the location, the security guard in the parking lot is a gem and does an excellent job! So much love for this place!

Best authentic Italian food with pasta sauce from the Frosinone region of Italy. Great pizza too.
Our family favorite for over 30 years. Great atmosphere (old school) and great people.
Delicious food..great service!
This place was better than our usual Italian restaurant. Enjoyed it all

We have dinner here all the time and we love love love it!!! another hidden gem in SW Detroit. Excellent service and the food is to die for.  Old time family owned and so worth the trip!!! The pizza rocks but so does everything!!!!!
